001import java.util.StringTokenizer;
002
003/**
004 * This class is part of the RPandaScape application. 
005 * RPandaScape is a very simple, text based adventure game.   
006 * 
007 * This parser reads user input and tries to interpret it as an "Adventure"
008 * command. Every time it is called it reads a line from the terminal and
009 * tries to interpret the line as a three word command. It returns the command
010 * as an object of class Command.
011 *  
012 * The parser has a set of known command words. It checks user input against
013 * the known commands, and if the input is not one of the known commands, it
014 * returns a command object that is marked as an unknown command.
015 * 
016 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau + Elie Duboux
017 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2013.09.15 + 20201.12.12
018 */
019public class Parser 
020{
021    /**
022     * Holds all valid command words.
023     */
024    private CommandWords aValidCommands;
025    
026    /**
027     * Create a parser to read from the terminal window.
028     */
029    public Parser() 
030    {
031        this.aValidCommands = new CommandWords();
032    } // Parser()
033
034    /**
035     * @return The next command from the user.
036     * @param pInputLine The string typed by the user.
037     */
038    public Command getCommand(final String pInputLine) 
039    {
040        String vWord1 = null;
041        String vWord2 = null;
042        String vWord3 = null;
043
044        // find up to two words on the line.
045        StringTokenizer vTokenizer = new StringTokenizer( pInputLine );
046        
047        if ( vTokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
048            vWord1 = vTokenizer.nextToken();      // get first word
049        else
050            vWord1 = null;
051
052        if ( vTokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
053            vWord2 = vTokenizer.nextToken();      // get second word
054        else
055            vWord2 = null;
056
057        if ( vTokenizer.hasMoreTokens() )
058            vWord3 = vTokenizer.nextToken();      // get second word
059        else
060            vWord3 = null;
061        // Now check whether this word is known. If so, create a command
062        // with it. If not, create a "null" command (for unknown command).
063        if ( this.aValidCommands.isCommand( vWord1 ) ) 
064            return (new Command( vWord1, vWord2, vWord3 ));
065        else 
066            return (new Command( null, null, null ));
067    }//getCommand()
068    
069    /**
070     * Get a list of valid command words.
071     * @return The String of the valid commands.
072     */
073    public String getCommandList()
074    {
075        return (this.aValidCommands.getCommandList());
076    }//getCommandList()
077} // Parser
